skill.name: elite-mvp-master
skill.description: Top 1% development standard for OC Pipeline and federal-grade construction software. Use when Bill asks to build features, fix bugs, write code, create components, or do any software development work. Activates for requests involving Supabase, Vercel, React, Node.js, database work, API development, or any coding tasks for OC Pipeline or related projects.
skill.summary: Top 1% development standard for OC Pipeline and federal-grade construction software. Use when Bill a...
skill.author: ALPA-Const

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only markdown instructions for AI behavior. No executable code, scripts, network calls, filesystem access, or external commands. Contains only communication standards and development guidelines for construction software development.

content.value_statement: OC Pipeline needs reliable software development standards for federal-grade construction management. This skill ensures every code deliverable meets top 1% quality standards with NIST compliance and production-readiness.
actual_capabilities: Generate production-ready React components with full TypeScript types
Write Supabase database migrations with proper security policies
Create API endpoints following federal contractor security standards
Implement error handling with user-friendly messages for non-technical users
Add inline documentation and code comments for maintainability
limitations: Limited to software development tasks for OC Pipeline project
Requires user to follow step-by-step implementation instructions
Designed for users with zero software development experience

use_cases.title: Federal project software requests
use_cases.description: Submit software feature requests for healthcare or federal construction projects with NIST compliance requirements

use_cases.title: Pipeline management features
use_cases.description: Build dashboard components for tracking construction bids, awards, and project stages across territories

use_cases.title: Compliance documentation tools
use_cases.description: Generate reports and tracking systems for CMMC Level 2 and SOC 2 compliance documentation

prompt_templates.title: Add new dashboard component
prompt_templates.scenario: Need a new React component for the main dashboard
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a production-ready React component for the OC Pipeline dashboard. Include Supabase data fetching, proper error handling, and TypeScript types. Give me the complete code and exact steps to add it to the project.

prompt_templates.title: Create database table
prompt_templates.scenario: Need a new database table with policies
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new Supabase table for [project data]. Include Row Level Security policies, proper indexes, and migration file. Show me the exact SQL and where to put it.

prompt_templates.title: Build API endpoint
prompt_templates.scenario: Need a secure API endpoint for external integration
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a secure API endpoint in the Next.js API routes. Follow NIST 800-171 requirements for federal data handling. Provide the full code and deployment steps.

prompt_templates.title: Fix production bug
prompt_templates.scenario: Something is broken in the deployed app
prompt_templates.prompt: Fix the bug where [describe issue]. Write production-ready code with proper error handling. Give me the complete fix and exact steps to deploy it to Vercel.

output_examples.input: Build a component to show our active construction projects with their current stage and value
output: **Building:** Project summary component for OC Pipeline dashboard
**Complete Code:** Full React component with TypeScript types, Supabase query, loading states, error handling
**Step 1:** Open src/components in your VS Code
**Step 3:** Paste the complete code I provide
**Step 5:** Import it in src/pages/index.tsx by adding: import ProjectSummary from '../components/ProjectSummary'
**Step 6:** Add <ProjectSummary /> where you want it to appear

best_practices: Always provide complete, working code with no placeholders or partial implementations
Include error handling that shows user-friendly messages for non-technical users
Follow Supabase, Vercel, and React best practices for production deployments
anti_patterns: Never provide partial code with comments like "// add your logic here"
Never skip error handling or validation for user inputs
Never use technical jargon without explaining the exact action to take

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Claude Code, and Codex for code generation tasks.

faq.question: What stack does this skill support?
faq.answer: Supabase, Vercel, React, Node.js, TypeScript, and Next.js API routes.

faq.question: Does this skill work with other projects?
faq.answer: No. This skill is specifically tuned for OC Pipeline federal construction software.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt skill with no external code execution or data access.

faq.question: What compliance standards does it follow?
faq.answer: NIST 800-171 and SOC 2 guidelines for federal contractor requirements.

faq.question: How is this different from general coding skills?
faq.answer: Built specifically for construction industry workflows with compliance-focused development standards.
